message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of leukocytes, bacteria, and nitrates in the urine dipstick suggests a urinary tract infection. Amoxicillin-clavulanate is safe to use in pregnant patients and is a recommended treatment option for urinary tract infections in pregnancy. Ciprofloxacin and doxycycline are contraindicated in pregnancy, and trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole has a higher risk of congenital abnormalities.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of leukocytes, bacteria, and nitrates on the urine dipstick suggests a urinary tract infection (UTI), which is common in pregnancy. Amoxicillin-clavulanate is considered safe for use in pregnancy and is the recommended treatment for UTIs in pregnant women. Ciprofloxacin and doxycycline are contraindicated in pregnancy, and trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole may cause birth defects in the first trimester.

Amoxicillin-clavulanate is a safe and effective treatment for UTIs in pregnancy, while ciprofloxacin and doxycycline are contraindicated due to potential harm to the developing fetus. Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole is also contraindicated in the first trimester of pregnancy.
